author: Staff Reporter
text:
An aged artisan Arumugam makes earthen pots for the ensuing Pongal festival at Murungapakkam in Puducherry on Tuesday.— Photo: S.S. Kumar

Eighty-year-old Arumugam from Murugampakkam has been making clay pots since he was a child.

Pongal festival is something which they look forward to.

At the age of 80, he makes at least 30 pots a day.

Not only pots, he also makes the tandoori pot for hotels and many an earthenware for weddings.

Untiring, he hopes to gain back the loss he incurred due to rains. “We could not work for three months. It is impossible to do this work during rains and we have incurred loss up to Rs. 30,000,” he says.
title: Untiring in his efforts
